paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) associated with transthyretin amyloidosis in a Thai cohort, detailing clinical profiles, penetrance data, and individual patient information.

patients.demographics: All Thais of mixed Thai Chinese descent, 55.6% male

individual_records.phenotype_details: Sensory, motor, autonomic neuropathy, carpal tunnel syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient A1 had sensory, motor, and autonomic neuropathy at presentation.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with significant clinical manifestations of neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: All patients had family history of amyloid polyneuropathy.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is predominantly found in Taiwanese and Han-Chinese populations.
key_quotes: This mutation has not yet been documented in any population other than Han Chinese-related populations, probably suggesting a founder effect.

tables_processed.table_caption: Neurophysiological profiles of symptomatic ATTRA97S-PN at the first and the last evaluations

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
